intro: Spermolepis divaricata, commonly known as the variable beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are tubular and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Spermolepis divaricata is often found in open habitats like grasslands and slopes.
